intro: Aneilema chrysopogon, commonly known as golden grass, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom during the warmer months. Its leaves are typically narrow and slightly hairy, contributing to its distinct appearance. Aneilema chrysopogon is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks.
